Class Registers

  • java.lang.Object
    • Registers

  • public class Registers
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Registers()
      Construct the Register unit.

    • Method Summary

      Activates the write operation.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Registers

        public Registers()
        Construct the Register unit. Initializes the registers to contain random values, except X31 (the zero register) is initalized to zero.

    • Method Detail

      • setRead1Reg

        public void setRead1Reg(boolean[] b)
        Selects the first read register
        Parameters:
        b - The register to read from, must be a 5-bit boolean array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if b is not a 5-bit boolean array

      • setRead2Reg

        public void setRead2Reg(boolean[] b)
        Selects the second read register
        Parameters:
        b - The register to read from, must be a 5-bit boolean array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if b is not a 5-bit boolean array

      • setWriteRegNum

        public void setWriteRegNum(boolean[] b)
        Selects the write register
        Parameters:
        b - The register to write to, must be a 5-bit boolean array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if b is not a 5-bit boolean array

      • setWriteRegData

        public void setWriteRegData(boolean[] b)
        Sets the data to be written to the write register. This method does not perform the write operation.
        Parameters:
        b - The data to write to the write register, must be a 32-bit boolean array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if b is not a 32-bit boolean array.

      • getReadReg1

        public boolean[] getReadReg1()
        Returns the data from the first read register.
        Returns:
        the data from the first read register.

      • getReadReg2

        public boolean[] getReadReg2()
        Returns the data from the second read register.
        Returns:
        the data from the second read register.

      • activateWrite

        public void activateWrite()
        Activates the write operation. Assumes that setWriteRegNum and setWriteRegData have already been called. This method saves the write data into the register set by setWriteRegNum.

      • print

        public void print()
        Print register contents to stdout for debugging purposes. Register contents are printed in human readable format, with the MSB on the left and the LSB on the right.

      • print

        public void print(java.io.PrintStream output)
        Use for debugging. Prints register contents to a PrintStream. Register contents are printed in human readable format, with the MSB on the left and the LSB on the right.
        Parameters:
        output - The output stream.
